reviews.review:
Un jeu très prenant car capable de susciter une vraie haine du monstre : ils sont repoussants, débiles et terriblement puissants. Killing floor est donc un bon défi.
Des graphismes qui tiennent la route, du sang à foison, une expérience de jeu difficile et des mises à jour de qualité font donc de Killing Floor un jeu à avoir.
En revanche les DLC sont de belles arnaques. De plus, la communauté n'est pas très agréable, et vous avez donc intérêt à jouer avec des amis.

Un bon jeu bourrin où la pitiée ne sera pas au rendez-vous. A jouer de préférence en rentrant des cours pour se défouler. Des mises à jours très fréquentes, des améliorations sans cesse du jeu, une grande diversité des armes comme l'AK-47 en passant par l'arbalète et les différents fusils à pompe... 
Bref, enfn un vrai plaisir à tuer des zombies pour quelques euros seulement !

Se cercate un'alternativa al L4D sappiate che Killing Floor è un gioco totalmente diverso, ma non per questo peggiore.
Regala ore di divertimento grazie alla possibilità di affrontare le ondate a diverse difficoltà fino ad un massimo di 6 giocatori, aggiungendo un sistema di crescita, di perks e di armi davvero interessante.
Da giocare per tutti gli amanti degli zombie... anche se questi teoricamente sono esperimenti umani :P

8 / 10

This is the funnest zombie shooter out today. Easily in top 5 of most entertaining FPS games I've ever played. Sometimes when I get home I just want to blow up some zombie heads, and this game is perfect for that. It's great for playing with friends too, and it has a friends section so you can find people easy without any stress.

This is a game I started playing on LAN-parties with friends and we had a lot of fun. There is a pretty high skill ceiling, a lot of ways to play, 6 different classes and a decent number of weapons.
The gameplay is simple - it's a coop game that supports up to 6 players and the goal is surviving waves of zombie enemies randomly spawning around the map. When a player dies, they become a spectator until the wave is killed. Then after each wave players have the chance to find a shop and buy some weapons and ammunition. The final wave is a boss.

Killing Floor requires teamwork, cooperation and team effor to survive. It's usually impossible to stay on a single position, players constantly have to move and keep enemies as far as possible. Each class has different abilities, medic has healing bonuses, specialist is better with shotguns and can weld door faster etc.

It's a pretty good coop game, cheap and easy to learn (although hard to master) so if you're looking for a new coop game, this is definitely something you should give a try to. I can't comment about the difference between Killing Floor 1 and Killing Floor 2 because the sequel wasn't released for Linux (yet), so the only thing I can say about it that it's definitely worse than KF1 since KF1 runs on the open source gaming platform and you don't have to be a slave of your own computer to play it.

A great game to play with friends as the challenge of all the zeds/zombies attempt to devour you, adding different kinds of enemies as the game progresses. You'll learn to work as a team to survive, have some fun moments, and experiment with the many perks and weapons that are offered. The workshop for this game also plays a roll in the fight, adding more enemies, weapons, and challenges. Strategy on maps is key, and the better the spot situated, the more likely a team will survive.
Great PvE game, easy to pick up, difficult to master.

Full of terror and excitement, this game will keep you playing for hours on end. Whether you're new to the genre or a zombie slaying veteran, there is a place for you in KF's ranks of mayhem. But be warned, the ZEDs are not to be taken lightly. They are thoughtless killing machines with no remorse for you or your team. Don't turn your back for too long, or you're dead. Play as a team, survive as a team! Welcome to Hell, we've been waiting.
